answerText: Einstein's letter to FDR [or Einstein's letter to Franklin Delano Roosevelt; or Einstein's letter about the atomic bomb; also accept the Einstein-Szilard letter, but do NOT read this alternate answer out loud; prompt on Einstein's letter][10] Most of the letter was written by this man, with whom he built a refrigerator without moving parts. He came up with the idea of a nuclear chain reaction and the electron microscope, among other things he never got credit for.
heading: Western Invitational Tournament |2013 | Alabama + Georgia Tech+ WUStL | 13 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This letter warned about a cessation of sales of uranium from Czechoslovakian mines. For 10 points each: [10] Name this letter sent to the American president in August 1939, advising him to begin atomic bomb research before the Nazis could get their hands on the weapon.
